private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labelled with vowels: A, E, I.
I can only pick up the top block of a stack and move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so the final stack from top to bottom is A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labelled with consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J.
I can only pick up the top block of a stack and move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so the final stack from top to bottom is A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J with J on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined multi-agent PDDL domain and problem that yields a valid plan for achieving the global stacking goal using FastDownwards.

public_information: There are ten uniquely labelled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J.
Only the top block of any stack may be picked up.
Agents may move exactly one block at a time.
One agent may only move vowel-labelled blocks, the other only consonant-labelled blocks.
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom E then G then F then A then J on top, Stack2 bottom I then C on top, Stack3 bottom D then B then H on top.
The global goal is a single stack with J on the table and I on J and H on I and G on H and F on G and E on F and D on E and C on D and B on C and A on B.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert high level planner for block manipulation restricted to vowel-labelled blocks. Provide safe, explicit, stepwise high-level actions that you can perform given your restrictions. Do not output PDDL. Keep actions distinct and make no assumptions about blocks you cannot manipulate.
analysis.prompt: Agent name: vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Describe, as an ordered list, the high-level pick and place actions you can perform that respect the rule that you may only move top blocks and only vowel-labelled blocks. Each action should be a single sentence specifying which block you pick, from which stack or block you pick it, and where you place it. If some actions require coordination, state the dependency and which agent must act.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert high level planner for block manipulation restricted to consonant-labelled blocks. Provide safe, explicit, stepwise high-level actions that you can perform given your restrictions. Do not output PDDL. Keep actions distinct and make no assumptions about blocks you cannot manipulate.
analysis.prompt: Agent name: consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Describe, as an ordered list, the high-level pick and place actions you can perform that respect the rule that you may only move top blocks and only consonant-labelled blocks. Each action should be a single sentence specifying which block you pick, from which stack or block you pick it, and where you place it. If some actions require coordination, state the dependency and which agent must act.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and preparing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. You must integrate the high-level actions provided by the agents into a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance. Ensure agent-specific actions remain distinct by prefixing action names with the agent identifier. Use standard STRIPS-style PDDL compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Include types, predicates for on, ontable, clear, holding, handempty, and actions pick and place for each agent as needed. The produced PDDL must reflect the initial stacks and the goal stack exactly.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Vowel agent analysis: {analysis_vowel_agent}. Consonant agent analysis: {analysis_consonant_agent}. Orchestrator private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep the agents' actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent name. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
